title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
General Considerations

The response must correctly articulate a defensible claim or thesis that responds to the prompt and establishes a line of reasoning.

For Task A, the thesis must make a defensible claim that establishes a line of reasoning as to whether or not it is necessary for governments to regulate formal political participation by restricting areas such as voting access and political protests using one or more of the provided course concepts: civil society; civil liberties; or political and social cleavages.

For Task B, the response supports the claim with one piece of specific and relevant evidence from one or more course countries. The evidence is relevant to one or more of the provided course concepts.

For Task C, the response uses reasoning to explain why the evidence supports the claim or thesis, using one or more of the provided course concepts.
descriptions: The responses accomplish none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for C they must first earn the B point.
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for C they must first earn the B point.
The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for C they must first earn the B point.
